title: For $4 million, a historic Jamaica Plain home with an indoor waterfall
author: Megan Johnson
bullets: Real Estate Tucked away from the hustle and bustle of Centre Street, this home is like a private oasis in the middle of Jamaica Plain.
The indoor waterfall at 45 Parley Ave.
Halsey Fulton The house at 45 Parley Avenue in Jamaica Plain has a “country feel” within the Boston city limits.

title: Man detained in connection with Brown University shooting has been released, authorities say
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Local News Two students were fatally shot and nine people were wounded Saturday afternoon during a final exam at the Ivy League university in Providence, Rhode Island.

A woman knelt to set flowers and light candles outside of Barus & Holley School at Brown University where two people were killed and nine people were injured by a gunman in Providence, Rhode Island December 14, 2025.

Jessica Rinaldi/The Boston Globe The person of interest detained in connection with the deadly mass shooting at Brown University Saturday has been released, officials said at a press conference late Sunday night.

title: Owner of Milton medical spa pleads guilty to injecting unapproved botulinum toxin
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Local News Rodrigo de Medeiros Siqueira, of Rodrigo Beauty, was also not licensed to prescribe drugs or perform injections.
Mark H.

Milstein/ Bloomberg News The owner of the Milton medical spa that was linked to at least 14 botulism cases this summer pleaded guilty to injecting clients with unapproved botulinum toxin, federal prosecutors said.

title: Child confirmed as Connecticut’s first measles case in 4 years
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Health The child, who is under the age of 10 and unvaccinated, recently traveled internationally, health officials said.
FILE - A measles, mumps and rubella vaccine at the Andrews County Health Department, Tuesday, April 8, 2025, in Andrews, Texas.

title: ‘In moments like this, we see the best of Rhode Island’: Leaders react to Brown shooting
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Local News "The firefighters, the policemen, the civil leaders, neighbors who come together, and let us celebrate that community," Sen.
Jack Reed said.
A sign thanking first responders stands in a neighborhood near Brown University, Sunday, Dec.

title: What the Bills said about ‘scary situation’ staying in Providence during Brown University shooting
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: New England Patriots "Some guys were eating dinner blocks away from where it was going on," quarterback Josh Allen said.
Josh Allen AP Photo/Robert F.
Bukaty FOXBOROUGH — Since Gillette Stadium is relatively close to Providence, some opposing teams opt to stay there when they come to play against the Patriots.

title: 24-year-old from Wisconsin reportedly detained after Brown University shooting
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Local News Benjamin Erickson, 24, was taken into custody at a hotel in Coventry, Rhode Island, according to multiple reports.
Police released surveillance footage of the person of interest sought after the Brown University shooting.
Providence police The person of interest detained was released, officials said at a press conference late Sunday evening.

title: ‘Let us play’: Patriots cornerback reacts to controversial fourth-quarter call
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: New England Patriots "Just seeing how late the flag came in, I think we're all thinking the same thing.
" Carlton Davis.
AP Photo/Vera Nieuwenhuis FOXBOROUGH – The Patriots were clinging on to a three-point lead with 8:19 to go in the fourth quarter.

title: Stefon Diggs explains why it was ‘good’ for Patriots to lose to Bills on Sunday
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots "It’s a lesson for sure that you’re going to have to keep that foot on the gas.
” Stefon Diggs and the Patriots can't dwell on Sunday's loss to Buffalo.
